{{Infobox Radio station |name = 2CN |image = |city = [[Canberra]], [[Australian Capital Territory]] |area = Canberra |branding = 666 ABC Canberra |slogan = |frequency = 666 [[kilohertz|kHz]] [[AM broadcasting|AM]] |translator = |repeater = |airdate = January, 1953 |share = |share as of = |share source = |format = [[Talk radio|Talk]] |language = [[English language|English]] |power = 5,000 [[watt]]s |erp = |haat = |class = |facility_id = |coordinates = {{coord|35|13|1|S|149|7|14|E|type:landmark_scale:2000_region:AU}} |callsign_meaning = |former_callsigns = |former_frequencies = |affiliations = [[ABC Local Radio]] |owner = [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] |licensee = |sister_stations = [[2RN]], [[2ABCFM]], [[2JJJ]] |webcast = |website = {{official|http://www.abc.net.au/canberra/}} }} [[File:ABC Canberra studios .jpg|thumb|ABC Canberra studios]] '''666 ABC Canberra''' (call sign: 2CN) is an [[ABC Local Radio]] station based in [[Canberra]] and broadcasting to the [[Australian Capital Territory]] and surrounding [[New South Wales]] region. This includes the cities and towns of [[Queanbeyan, New South Wales|Queanbeyan]], [[Yass, New South Wales|Yass]] and [[Bungendore, New South Wales|Bungendore]]. The station began as '''2CN''' in [[1953]]{{cite news|date=22 January 1953|newspaper=Canberra Times|page=4}} originally broadcasting on 1540 AM then on 1440 AM. In [[1983]] it changed to the current [[AM Broadcasting|AM]] frequency of 666 [[Kilohertz|kHz]]. The station first broadcast from studios based at the transmitter site at [[Gungahlin, Australian Capital Territory|Gungahlin]]. In [[1957]] the station relocated to the centre of Canberra, before finally moving to purpose-built studios in [[Dickson, Australian Capital Territory|Dickson]] in [[1964]]. ABC Radio announced digital radio services in Canberra, the simulcast of 666 ABC Canberra, ABC Radio National, ABC Classic FM, ABC News Radio and triple j will launch in 2011. ==Local Programs== ===Weekdays=== *Breakfast with Ross Solly â 5:30 AM to 8:00 AM and 8:30 AM to 9:00 AM *Mornings with Alex Sloan â 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM *Afternoons with Genevieve Jacobs â 1:00 PM to 3:00 PM *Drive with Louise Maher â 3:00 PM to 6:00 PM ===Saturday=== *Weekends with Greg Bayliss â 6:00 AM to 8:00 AM *Gardening with Graham Williams â 8:30 AM to 11:00 AM *Granstand with Tim Gavel - 11:00AM to 12:00PM When local programs are not broadcast the station is a relay of [[702 ABC Sydney]]. ==Ratings== {| style="border: 1px solid #CCCCCC; margin-left: 10px;" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" |+ '''Canberra Radio Ratings - Survey 1, 2011: Station Share (All 10+)''' [http://au.nielsen.com/products/documents/Canberra12011.pdf Nielsen Media Research Survey 1, 2011]
'''(Previous in Brackets)''' |- | [[104.7 (Canberra)|104.7]] || 18.8 (18.0) |- | '''666 ABC''' || 15.9 (17.3) |- | [[Mix 106.3]] || 15.8 (15.5) |- | [[Triple J]] || 10.9 (9.0) |- | [[ABC Classic FM]] || 8.4 (9.2) |- | [[2CC]] || 7.4 (5.8) |- | [[ABC Radio National]] || 6.9 (8.0) |- | [[2CA]] || 5.6 (5.7) |- | [[ABC NewsRadio]] || 4.6 (4.2) |} ==References== {{reflist}} {{cite web |title=The 666 ABC Canberra story |url= http://www.abc.net.au/local/stories/2008/03/03/2178510.htm |date=2008-03-03 |accessdate=2008-05-29 |publisher=[[ABC Online]] }} ==See also== {{ABC Local Radio}} {{Canberra FM}} ==External links== * [http://twitter.com/666canberra 666canberra] on Twitter [[Category:Radio stations in Canberra]] [[Category:Radio stations established in 1953]]
